issue.title: First party tracking script + tracking subdomains
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Many websites are using common first party tracking script.

### Proposed solution

Some examples..

At `clearstem.com`,
lftce.clearstem.com/load

fromourplace.com
oorto.fromourplace.com/load

philosophy.com
qphil.philosophy.com/providers/atLabel/load

lapolicegear.com
hbpvm.lapolicegear.com/providers/atLabel/load

I suggest adding these rules. Not all the scripts start with `/providers/`, so I added a second general rule. It should block all these here without needing to add any other domains.

`/providers/atLabel/load`
`/init?*fallbackUserId=*^pageUrl=`
`||customers.edgetag.io^` CNAME, should be found in first two
`||fallback.attntags.com^` CNAME, fallback if blocked

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/26c46cb4-10ce-4524-8745-81d43cc30feb)

</details>

I've also collected a list of domains(90) for sake of DNS filtering. Some websites have two. All are first party.

<details><summary>Subdomains</summary>

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.0 to 16.1.2
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.0 to 16.1.2.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

v16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

Commits
  • 0c48e29 chore(changeset): release
  • e07227e perf: call rev-parse only once instead of three times when resolving git repo
  • 38f942e fix: remove extra log entry
  • 5031a71 perf: further optimize file chunking
  • 6ec38b9 perf: optimize file list length calculation (#1581)
  • a7c0c88 fix: only stage changes to deleted files if they're no longer deleted after r...
  • ccd5edd test: pass --no-error-on-unmatched-pattern to prettier command in --diff-opti...
  • 48a6e95 test: add failing test for staged deleted files not passed directly to tasks ...
  • b56b29e test: add failing test for staged deleted files with diff filter D
  • 8420429 chore(changeset): release
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lint-staged&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=16.1.0&new-version=16.1.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://rentalking.pl/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Frentalking.pl%2F) ### Comment > For some time now, I have had a Lifetime license (Family) installed on my laptop, both on the system and in the browser. Recently, I created a website for my client based on WordPress (https://rentalking.pl/). Unfortunately, since then, my website has been loading very slowly for all visitors, and the error console points to some issue with local.adguard.org. > > I thought the problem might be caused by a script on the site, so I completely removed it and reinstalled it, but unfortunately, the issue persists. It seems as if AdGuard is blocking some components of my site at the domain level, causing them to load very slowly. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Please enable `AdGuard Popups filter`.

By the way, there is a bug in nightly 8 that causes that annoyance filter lists are disabled on every reboot - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForWindows/issues/5503 
Another problem is that manual filters update does not work - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForWindows/issues/5512

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.0 to 16.1.2
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.0 to 16.1.2.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

v16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

Commits
  • 0c48e29 chore(changeset): release
  • e07227e perf: call rev-parse only once instead of three times when resolving git repo
  • 38f942e fix: remove extra log entry
  • 5031a71 perf: further optimize file chunking
  • 6ec38b9 perf: optimize file list length calculation (#1581)
  • a7c0c88 fix: only stage changes to deleted files if they're no longer deleted after r...
  • ccd5edd test: pass --no-error-on-unmatched-pattern to prettier command in --diff-opti...
  • 48a6e95 test: add failing test for staged deleted files not passed directly to tasks ...
  • b56b29e test: add failing test for staged deleted files with diff filter D
  • 8420429 chore(changeset): release
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lint-staged&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=16.1.0&new-version=16.1.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

pull_request.title: Bump lint-staged from 16.1.0 to 16.1.2
pull_request.body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 16.1.0 to 16.1.2.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

v16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

Commits
  • 0c48e29 chore(changeset): release
  • e07227e perf: call rev-parse only once instead of three times when resolving git repo
  • 38f942e fix: remove extra log entry
  • 5031a71 perf: further optimize file chunking
  • 6ec38b9 perf: optimize file list length calculation (#1581)
  • a7c0c88 fix: only stage changes to deleted files if they're no longer deleted after r...
  • ccd5edd test: pass --no-error-on-unmatched-pattern to prettier command in --diff-opti...
  • 48a6e95 test: add failing test for staged deleted files not passed directly to tasks ...
  • b56b29e test: add failing test for staged deleted files with diff filter D
  • 8420429 chore(changeset): release
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

comment.body:
Известно, что эта проблема решается с помощью AdGuard Extra.

Если вы пользуетесь AdGuard на устройствах Windows, Mac или Android, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что AdGuard Extra включена в настройках приложения.

Если вы используете расширение AdGuard для браузера, рекомендуется также установить AdGuard Extra.

* [Установка на браузеры Chrome, Edge или другие, основанные на Chromium](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Установка на Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://rentalking.pl/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Frentalking.pl%2F) ### Comment > For some time now, I have had a Lifetime license (Family) installed on my laptop, both on the system and in the browser. Recently, I created a website for my client based on WordPress (https://rentalking.pl/). Unfortunately, since then, my website has been loading very slowly for all visitors, and the error console points to some issue with local.adguard.org. > > I thought the problem might be caused by a script on the site, so I completely removed it and reinstalled it, but unfortunately, the issue persists. It seems as if AdGuard is blocking some components of my site at the domain level, causing them to load very slowly. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
I see it's not related to our app. Perhaps there were something wrong when you deployed it. You can try it without our app.
Another option is to exclude the site from the filtration. Note that the filtering log can help you to do that - there you will see all requests, also detailed by the app from which they come.
You can use a rule below to do that, but change the domain to the necessary one. `$app` modifier helps if you need to limit it to, for instance, some app or browser for work.
```adblock
@@||example.com^$document
```

comment.body:
Hi!

> Could you please advise me on how to correctly configure the filtering so that the website is not blocked?

In that case, the filtering log should be opened. There you can see which requests are filtered by the app as blocked, modified etc.
For instance, if you see `example.com` (could be any domain) is blocked (marked red in the FL), you can add the mentioned rule to user rules, so it will be excluded from the filtration.

comment.body:
Reproduced few times, but not now.
Forwarded to CoreLibs team.

As a temporary workaraund this rule can be added to User Rules:
`@@||telegraaf.nl^$jsinject,elemhide,extension`

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: m.facebook.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.facebook.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.facebook.com%2F) ### Comment > When scrolling down or up the feed on Facebook mobile page (m.facebook.com), at some point when you have scrolled enough, posts start "jumping". > > In practice, I get scrolled back to previous post. This doesn't happen on each post, but at some point it starts to happen quite frequently. > > This can't be presented via screenshots, but in those screenshots I've already scrolled past the post that has a blonde woman on it and the fishing post is now appearing. From that point, when I scroll forward, I get thrown back so that the fishing post disappears and I see the post that was before the post with a blonde woman. > > Looking at the DOM at the same time when scrolling and this issue appears, I see that an ad post that was hid earlier, gets its "displayed" class removed from it. And if I scroll to the other direction, it gets added back (and I jump back to my previous location at the feed). I think that Facebook still manipulates those already hidden ad elements, which causes me to jump into wrong place at the Feed. > > If I remove those hidden ad posts (the whole node) this issue doesn't appear. > > "displayed" class already gets removed and added back to regular posts when scrolling up and down but that doesn't cause issues. Only when that class is removed or added back to an already hidden ad element. Username: `@peace2000` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/4h8rhrz5xl6oo040gkssc8ckgkgkgkoyxmtckwwz7k.png?nc=1)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://m.facebook.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fm.facebook.com%2F) ### Comment > When scrolling down or up the feed on Facebook mobile page (m.facebook.com), at some point when you have scrolled enough, posts start "jumping". > > In practice, I get scrolled back to previous post. This doesn't happen on each post, but at some point it starts to happen quite frequently. > > This can't be presented via screenshots, but in those screenshots I've already scrolled past the post that has a blonde woman on it and the fishing post is now appearing. From that point, when I scroll forward, I get thrown back so that the fishing post disappears and I see the post that was before the post with a blonde woman. > > Looking at the DOM at the same time when scrolling and this issue appears, I see that an ad post that was hid earlier, gets its "displayed" class removed from it. And if I scroll to the other direction, it gets added back (and I jump back to my previous location at the feed). I think that Facebook still manipulates those already hidden ad elements, which causes me to jump into wrong place at the Feed. > > If I remove those hidden ad posts (the whole node) this issue doesn't appear. > > "displayed" class already gets removed and added back to regular posts when scrolling up and down but that doesn't cause issues. Only when that class is removed or added back to an already hidden ad element. Username: `@peace2000` ### Screenshots

Not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

issue.title: Block Mozilla Firefox Telemetry
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [x] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Please add the following Mozilla Firefox telemetry hosts to the Adguard Tracking Protection list:

   ● incoming.telemetry.mozilla.org
   ● classify-client.services.mozilla.com
   ● normandy.cdn.mozilla.net
   ● normandy.tombstone.experimenter.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net

The first two are basic telemetry and privacy leaks. The second two allow Mozilla to change browser settings and remotely install extensions without user intervention.

### Proposed solution

As mentioned above, adding these filters will block all Firefox Telemetry and Privacy Leaks.

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
These are useful telemetry, not typical trackers that are used for the sole purpose of tracking users. So I don't think the AdGuard team will add these to their list. 
Rely on a separate list to block these.

issue.title: Youtube started showing video ads again - May 27, 2025

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Safari ### AdGuard version AdGuard for Safari Version 1.11.22 (build 347, CT 2.0.44) ### What type of problem have you encountered? Missed ads or ad leftovers ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? youtube.com ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets AdGuard Social Media filter ### Annoyances AdGuard Annoyances filter ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots I am reporting https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d6887944-583e-417e-b12e-07689057547b an issue with [YouTube.com](http://youtube.com/) video ads that appear at the beginning of any video. Please note this is a very recent regression that started on May 27, 2025 and prior to that all video ads were blocked. The behaviour is different on iPhone where mobile version of YouTube in Safari is used. In that case all ads are blocked as before. In desktop Safari, with latest AdGuard and all most up to date filters, the behaviour is different for logged in case vs viewing without logging in. If I don't log in to my account, no video ads are displayed. When clicking on any video, it plays immediately with no spinner and no ads. If I do log in, the behaviour changes: Once you click on any video, the page loads and video does not play immediately. Initially, spinner is displayed for quite long time and after that an ad is displayed. You have an option to skip the ad and then the video plays normally. Please note that Brave Browser with its default ad blocker does not display any ads and videos start immediately. Firefox with uBlock Origin also works as normal. iPad Safari (latest iPadOS, Adguard Pro and filters up to date) also shows the same experience and desktop Safari. Interestingly engough Brave Browser on iPad does block all ads as before and video startup experience is different. Videos play immediately and no ads are shown. Here is some relevant systems info: macOS 15.5 (24F74), Safari Version 18.5 (20621.2.5.11.8) with AdGuard for Safari Version 1.11.22. iPadOS 18.5 with AdGuard Pro for iOS version 4.5.10 (1029) ### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: Recent filter update has fixed this issue. Videos now also load and are ready to play so much faster.
